attributes.action: Make it so that gender segregation, within P.E at school, is no longer allowed.
attributes.background: School's have become accustomed to separating genders in P.E. This is understandable in contact sports, such as Rugby, but why should it be so in non-contact sports. Sign this petition so that gender segregation is a thing of the past!

attributes.action: Omit the requirement for a TV License in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation
attributes.background: At present all serving personnel in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation require a TV License. An exemption should be made for Forces personnel on HM establishments whom reside due to a duty move.
attributes.additional_details:
Many serving personnel temporarily reside at HM establishments throughout the week, thus require a TV License for two addresses. The one exemption to the rule is that a TV can be watched on a license for another address if the device is battery operated and not mains powered.  iaw http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one/for-your-home/armed-forces-personnel-aud7.
Serving personnel are requested to move frequently to temporary locations for training courses.

attributes.action: Equalise public spending per capita throughout the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland get higher payments per capita than England. This is unreasonable. All countries in the UK should receive the same amount per capita.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014/15, public spending per capita in the UK as a whole was £8,913. In England, it was £8,638 (3% below the UK average). This compares with:
• Scotland: £10,374 (16% above the UK average – 20% higher than England)
• Wales: £9,904 (11% above the UK average – 14.7% higher than England)
• Northern Ireland £11,106 (25% above the UK average – 28.6% higher than England).
(Data source: House of Commons Briefing Paper Number 04300, 8 March 2015)

attributes.action: MP's and spouses/partners release tax returns from the date the are elected.
attributes.background: In the interests of complete transparency, the UK electorate need to know if elected officials and their spouses/partners have vested interests that help their decision making.
attributes.additional_details: From the date they are elected, all elected officials and their spouses/partners should be obligated to publish their tax returns.

attributes.action: Allow katy James to stay in the Uk with her husband and 2 year old daughter!
attributes.background:
Katy has been married to her husband Dominic for 9 years and they have a 2 year old daughter, Katy has been denied a visa because her husband doesn't "earn enough"

This is unfair and no parent should be seperated from their child

attributes.action: Force food companies to label ALL types of sugar on all packaging as SUGAR
attributes.background:
Regardless of how they sound, the following are all sugar:
Cane juice, Dehydrated cane juice, Cane juice solids, Cane juice crystals, Dextrin, Maltodextrin, Dextran, Barley malt, Beet sugar, Corn syrup, Carob syrup, Brown sugar, Date sugar, Malt syrup, Fruit juice, Fruit juice concentrate.
attributes.additional_details: One of the most common tricks is to distribute sugars among many ingredients so that sugars don‘t appear in the top three. For example, a manufacturer may use a combination of sucrose, high-fructose corn syrup, corn syrup solids, brown sugar, dextrose and other sugar ingredients to make sure none of them are present in large enough quantities to attain a top position on the ingredients list (remember, the ingredients are listed in order of their proportion in the food, common ingredients first !

attributes.action: DVLA need a telephone customer department that corrects the mistakes they  make
attributes.background:
DVLA fined us for their mistake with our DIrect Debit.
It has been shocking to find they have no telephone service for their mistakes to be sorted out.  Only telephone lines to pay the "fine" even when you don't owe them it. Very stressful time trying to sort it out.

attributes.action: all petitions with over 200000 signatures put to uk general election style vote
attributes.background:
petitions are often signed and not even discussed in parmlimant this gives the uk public a lack of confidence in the whole petition consept 
if every petition that reached 200000 signatures had to be voted on in an election style vote uk opinons would be voiced from the people for the people
attributes.additional_details:
this concept could be easily implimented by adding all succsesfull petitons to local and or general election questionares forms and voted on the same day reducing cost and increasing likelyhood to vote

the number 200000 is only a ballpar amount of votes if sucsesfull the amount of signature could be agreed upon for less or more but a garuntee of public intrest in the petiton idea would sertainly be sparked because the whole petition basis would have a more definative and resolved end result

attributes.action: Stop schools charging a fee to allow children to eat packed lunches.
attributes.background: Some state schools are charging parents up to £1.80 per child daily to eat a packed lunch on school premises. This is as much as the cost of a school meal.  Parents are paying twice to feed their children. The cost is disproportionate to the effort expended by the school to supervise lunchtimes.
attributes.additional_details:
This was uncovered by the teaching union NASUWT and reported in the press on 28th March 2016. 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationnews/12206157/State-schools-charge-parents-to-let-children-eat-their-own-packed-lunches.html

attributes.action: Refer Amazon to the competition authorities.
attributes.background: In The Telegraph interview Rohan Silva, a former adviser to David Cameron and George Osborne, said the lack of competition in the book market is “really horrifying”, allowing Amazon to dominate.I’m absolutely aghast about what the government and competition authorities have allowed Amazon to do.
attributes.additional_details:
What the Society of Authors and their memebers think of Amazon can be found here: http://www.societyofauthors.org/what-do-we-think-amazon

The background to this petition can be found at this link: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/shopping-and-consumer-news/12167545/Government-must-help-end-heartbreaking-Amazon-dominance-former-Number-10-adviser-says.html?WT.mc_id=e_DM89475&WT.tsrc=email&etype=Edi_Pol_New_EU&utm_source=email&utm_medium=Edi_Pol_New_EU_2016_02_22&utm_campaign=DM89475

attributes.action: Make it law that all bus companies must have space for 2 wheelchairs and a Pram
attributes.background:
Were asking that we catch up with mainland europe when it comes to disability access especially on transport such as buses who currently only allow one wheelchair and a pram.

Disabled people travel together and to expect them to catch separate buses so they can go out together is disgraceful!
attributes.additional_details:
Its time we caught up with mainland europes public transport giving a minimum of 2 priority wheelchair spaces on each bus and a space for 1 or 2 prams.

Wheelchair users find it hard to use public transport but if your a wheelchair user with another friend whos a wheelchair user you find it impossible to go out together as you have to take separate buses some which could be an hour apart.

Its time the companies providing the service were made to make this a requirement making it fairer for all

attributes.action: Drug test all ministers and senior civil servants including the military
attributes.background: Rig workers are tested to avoid destroying the North Sea in fact lots of employers demand a pre employment tests. Our representatives are running the country and far too many senior politicians behave and look like they are on much more than fairy dust .We deserve the best.

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the airstrikes/bombings in Syria
attributes.background: British parliament to re-vote on military action in Syria, in light of the civilian casualities this has caused. British govt to put pressure on the Syrian govt and the coalition forces to ground their airforces & stop bombarding civilian areas, schools & hospitals through indiscriminate strikes.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has been the second largest contributor to the air campaign in Iraq. In November 2015 the government suggested that the UK had carried out 8% of coalition air strikes in Iraq. 

On 7 July 2016 the MOD confirmed that the UK had conducted more than 2,800 missions, including 915 airstrikes against ISIS targets in both Iraq and more recently Syria (865 and 50 strikes respectively). It went on to state that “the RAF has not operated at this sustained operational tempo in a single theatre of conflict for a quarter of a century”.

The Government has consistently maintained that no civilian casualties in Iraq or Syria, to date, have resulted from UK air strikes. This is no longer accurate and thus the policy on offensive action needs to be revisited.

attributes.action: Extreme vetting of immigrants and visitors to the UK
attributes.background: I would like to call for "extreme" ideological vetting of immigrants seeking admission to the UK. People coming to this country must decry their former way of life, and agree to live under a FREE Society who allow FREEDOM OF SPEECH!
attributes.additional_details:
Hate Speech should equally mean HATE speech against Jews and Christians too ... not just islam. It needs to be stated categorically that islam is NOT a race, it is made of many races, just as Christianity is.
People entering should undergo a test, and have to prove they will no longer follow the laws they left. Implementing the policy overhaul would require a temporary halt in immigration from "the most dangerous and volatile regions of the world that have a history of exporting terrorism

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: Change the 40 year rolling exemption for classic vehicles to 30 year.
attributes.background: I feel that the standard should be revised from 40 years to 30 years. Many cars over 25 years now are classic cars and are on classic car policys which do little mileage per year. Cars over 20 years are rarely seen on the road on a daily basis so I think the above should be revised.
attributes.additional_details: My vehicle is a classic car and is 26 years old. It is on classic car insurance as there are only 30 of my vehicle on the road and is classed as a classic vehicle by my insurer so why shouldn't I get historic car status in 4 years time.

attributes.action: To Criminalize Ticket buying bots from buying up tickets for events
attributes.background: Ticket Buying bots should be criminalized and the practice made illegal. botnets are programmes which are used to target ticketing agents. They buy tickets at high speed and stop fans from being able to buy tickets at face value the tickets are then resold on other sites at greater value
attributes.additional_details:
For Example Harry potter tickets £15 pounds per part on the official website 
Stubhub ticket web site anything from £150 - £1750

attributes.action: Benefit sanctions must be stopped without exception.
attributes.background: Benefit sanctions are being handed out unlawfully.

attributes.action: Commence an urgent review of the Child Maintenance Service Policies/Procedures.
attributes.background: The service levels offered by the Child Maintenance Service are exceptionally poor, staff are unhelpful and do not carry out instructions within reasonable timescales.  Also, the use of Gross Income in the calculations is unfair and takes no account of paying parents financial circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered from numerous issues created by this agency and am being financially disadvantaged by them and I am sure I am not alone.  Whilst the majority of paying parents have no issue paying maintenance, it is unfair and unjust that payments do not take into account the financial circumstances of either the paying or the receiving parent.

attributes.action: Stop Housing Associations charging more than social rent on their properties.
attributes.background: My 20 years old has a 1 bedroom Circle 33 Housing Association property and her rent in £189.00 per week.  Another Circle property 2 minutes away is £129.00 p/w. She is under so much stress and anxiety worrying about getting work and paying her rent and not ending up homeless.
attributes.additional_details: She will have to claim a portion of Housing Benefit as she will not be in a position to pay it all herself.  Surely if the rent was lowered there would be smaller claims for Housing Benefit, possibly no claims at all in some circumstances being made. Surely it is common sense to reduce the rent to reduce the amount of Housing Benefit claims being made.  There is nothing included the £189.00 rent, e.g. water rates or care taking facilities.

attributes.action: Help London workers and locals be home owners: restrict multi-property buying.
attributes.background: London house prices keep soaring, and only wealthy UK and foreign investors benefit as they buy up the capital, at prices only they can afford. Home owning is unattainable for locals and workers living in the capital, making renting their only option. Again, rents are high and saving to buy is hard.
attributes.additional_details:
Laws need to be put into place to restrict mass buying from wealthy individuals, as well control on companies.
London is driven by its workers/locals but house prices are causing people to leave to other cities. Plus those commuting into London are being pushed further out as the outskirts also become unaffordable. 
This petition urges the Government implement laws to help more people become home owners in the Capital, and restrict the benefits to investors raking in ridiculous rental income!

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk

attributes.action:
Car Tax Refund takes too long
Should be immediate from the day car sold
attributes.background:
There is no period of grace buying a car to taxing it The DVLA obtain immediate monies
Refund from selling a car takes up to 6 weeks.
You only get the refund from the following full month. That means there is an awful lot of surplus cash sitting somewhere. 
This practice needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
If a bank held onto our cash without letting us have our money there would be an outcry. Why should the DVLA hold onto our money.
As soon as a car is taxed online the DVLA must be made to give an immediate refund on the car that has been sold. Money is taken electronically therefore should be refunded electronically.

attributes.action: Change policy "reducing drugs & misuse & dependence" for Fibromyalgia sufferers.
attributes.background:
it is trying to reduce the misuse of prescription drugs.
However , due to the stigma associated with Fibromyalgia & M.E, by some in the medical profession and the fact we are living with an invisible illness I feel many people living with Fibro & M.E are wrongly assumed to be misusing medication.
attributes.additional_details: I have gone from working hard all my life and never taking from the system to a person in agony most days, I need help with dressing, can't cook, can't drive, as a consequence of the pain all over my body I have become very depressed and fear for my future. I am no longer able to work and I am about to go on zero wages and will have to retire due to being too ill. I am 47. The only thing that helps me is my  medication which has taken 6 months to get right, but I now have to beg for weekly.

attributes.action: Invest more funds into research, management & recovery of CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue
attributes.background: After being diagnosed with CFS/ME Chronic Fatigue Syndrome in 2013, I've struggled to get any ongoing support for my symptoms, management and recovery. There's simply not enough understood about the condition within the NHS or the general public. More research and media exposion is urgently needed!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.meassociation.org.uk

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/how-you-can-help/introduction-to-our-cbt-get-and-pacing-report/

http://www.meassociation.org.uk/research2015/cfsme-research-collaborative/

https://www.actionforme.org.uk

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/ifp/chapter/Managing-CFSME

https://www.nice.org.uk/guidance/cg53/evidence/full-guideline-196524109

attributes.action: Review the way the Department of Work and Pensions treats mentally ill claimants
attributes.background: I am doing this on behalf of a friend who has suffered with long term depression and has been treated appallingly by the DWP. I am concerned that this is not a one-off case and that there are a lot of vulnerable people who are being treated in such an irresponsible and dangerous manner.

attributes.action: Dads given 10 weeks parental leave with pay for more time with their new born
attributes.background: I believe dads should be around more with there new born child, some fathers work late nights and end up having to only see the new born child while they are sleeping. 2 weeks isn't anywhere near acceptable amount of time, also having dad home longer it will be great help for the mother and bonding.

attributes.action: Reintroduce the dredging of rivers to reduce flooding risk...
attributes.background: The EU directive effectively stopped rivers being dredged causing flash flooding because of the reduced capacity of rivers and their inability to contain run off. Now we are no longer at the behest of the EU we can reintroduce this effective means of flood control...

attributes.action: To scrap Grades 1 - 9 and go back to A - U grading/marking.
attributes.background: There is no standardised system or coherent system that any one school can take and use. The system is failing children as schools are unsure how to use the new marking system so the children suffer. This petition is highlighting the need to revert back to simple but effective A - U marking.
attributes.additional_details: As teachers we have a duty of care towards our children and if we are unable to mark correctly, the Department for Education is setting schools and children up to fail. We have not seen any good positive need for this marking system and we are now angry at having to use it over and above a perfectly good marking system used for many years prior. Children’s minds should not be bogged down with a complicated marking system. Go back to A - U, keep it simple and teaching improves.

attributes.action: BRING BACK DEATH PENALTY FOR TERROISM AND TREASON
attributes.background:
bring back the death penalty for terroism acts against the united kingdom 
also bring back the death penalty on anyone who commits treason this should be anyone who tries to burn the flag tries to turn people against the united kingdom and  cause hatred

attributes.action: Remove the NHS from political control. HM Government to set NHS budgets only.
attributes.background: The NHS should be run by a board of governors who are accountable to Parliament, like the BBC, with sensible targets, acceptable staffing levels and long-term plans. Politicians could then honestly debate the real issue, FUNDING, allowing a clear choice between parties which would interest voters.
attributes.additional_details: Constant reorganisation by politicians has damaged the NHS: it is divisive and saps energy, focus and productivity; there has been little time for benefits to show. Some change has been driven by political ideology from both sides without much clinical benefit. Governments only look 5 years ahead, until the next election. A quick fix for 5 years is no good. An independent but accountable, properly managed NHS would use research and sound experience to make plans for us all for the long term.

attributes.action: We demand a response to the killing of African Americans by the U.S police.
attributes.background: Following the murders of Philando Castile and Alton Sterling, we demand an official response from Her Majesty’s Government in parliament and international pressure on the US Government, the US Congress and the US Department of Justice to reform its gun laws and police use of deadly force.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years, investigations into the high profile police killings of the following victims have yielded no police convictions:
Mike Brown (unarmed, shot whilst complying with police orders)
Tamir Rice (12 year old shot without question for holding a toy gun)
Eric Garner (unarmed, choked to death)
Rekia Boyd (unarmed girl, shot without warning in the head)
Amadou Diallo (unarmed, shot 41 times)
Sean Bell (unarmed, shot 50 times on his wedding day)
Kimani Gray
Freddie Gray

attributes.action: No fees for parents who wish to know info about their kids from social services
attributes.background: When couples separate, it's very difficult to iron out the terms when it comes to children and many end up in court. For a non residential parent, they must apply for information from social services and then pay a fee to get written information. None can be given by phone
attributes.additional_details: Bromley Council was contacted by a father to ask what is happening with he's daughter, as court cafcass reports stated problems with the health and education of he's child.  Social services said he must apply for freedom of information by form on their website. The letter he recieved back stated he needs to pay £10 fee plus obtain documents such as birth certificate for he's child. The mother has this so he also has to buy he's own at a cost. This info should be free once ID or rights proven

attributes.action: NO guarantee for EU nationals in UK without equality for Brits in EU.
attributes.background: Brits were encouraged for 30 years to invest in EU by buying houses for their retirement in a favourable climate for their health. Is it the wish of the British people for over a million UK pensioners to lose everything they have worked for all their lives?

attributes.action: Amend MP's Oath to include a commitment to Nolan's 7 principles of public life
attributes.background: Nolan's 7 principles of public life (selflessness, integrity, objectivity, accountability, openness, honesty & leadership) are in Ministerial Code as a conduct guide, but should be made key and an explicit commitment for MPs.  The Oath MP's swear should include a promise to uphold the principles.
attributes.additional_details: Nolan's 7 principles of public life: www.gov.uk/government/publications/the-7-principles-of-public-life

attributes.action: A general election to be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down.
attributes.background: This petition is to demand that a general election be held when the Prime Minister David Cameron steps down as Prime Minister. It is not right that a different Conservative candidate be given this position of power without winning a general election.
attributes.additional_details: It is only fair to the people of the United Kingdom that we be allowed a general election to elect our new Prime Minister when Mr Cameron officially leaves his post.

attributes.action: Theresa May must apologise for policies developed while Home Secretary
attributes.background: She should apologise to thousands of wrongfully deported students. She should apologise to non-EU spouses who had to leave the UK because their partner earned under £18,600. She should apologise to Tier 2 skilled workers being forced to leave the UK for earning under £35k, and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
She has refused to release court records that prove the students were wrongfully deported. She refused to prosecute high-profile journalists accused of phone hacking, one of which worked for the Government. She tried to ban WhatsApp.

She introduced laws that mean 36% of migrant primary teachers and 9% of migrant senior school teachers will be forced to leave the UK, due to the Tier 2 settlement threshold of £35k.

She opposes the Equality Act 2010. She has argued against the Human Rights Act.

attributes.action: Debate the rich poor divide, media bias and its effects on fear of immigration
attributes.background: We want parliament to move debates beyond the fear of migration and what to do about it. To the socio-economic background within which this fear is being nurtured and what to do about that. Including media coverage of the topic, tax avoidance-depriving the UK of revenue & the growing rich/ poor gap.
attributes.additional_details: Open and forward thinking discussion is urgently needed to re-dress the in balance of the economics of globalisation, money markets and the effects of private lobbying within Westminster by big business and private individuals. Trickle down is not working and wealth is pooling upwards instead. Leaving fewer resources for ever greater numbers of people world wide. I believe this is a root cause for the current fear of immigration in the UK which is being fuelled by facets of invested media.

attributes.action: British government should pay costs for 15 year plus ex pats to be EU citizens.
attributes.background: Ex pats that still hold a British passport and have been ex pats for 15 plus years in an EU land and were not allowed to vote in the EU rederendum should have the costs of changing citizenship to that of their current EU home, covered by the British Government.
attributes.additional_details: We had no say in the referendum but we may have to leave our EU homes due to stricter EU rules that may be imposed on British ex pats. This is undemocratic. A compensatory amount of no less than €1500,00 should me made available to any 15 year plus expat who chooses to revoke their British citizenship.  A separate arrangement should also be considered for any British State pension funds that may have accrued.

attributes.action: Make the work-coaches at the DWP Jobcentre Plus work on commission.
attributes.background: I want them to go on commission-only because they don't really help jobseekers to get work... And by that they will only get paid if they find work to a customer and that job is suitable (skills wise) for the customer.

attributes.action: Until Brexit Article 50 details are agreed, plans for HS2 should be put on hold.
attributes.background: The UK is undergoing considerable economic and financial strain. As this situation will continue, at least, until such time as all the EU severance details (Article 50) are worked through, the UK Government should put an immediate stop and hold on any further development of the HS2 project.

attributes.action: Cross-party statement condemning hate crimes & a debate on firmer punishments
attributes.background: Since the referendum people have been using the result as an opportunity to express racism and hate. This is to ask all political parties and politicians to come together on a joint statement to stand united against racism and hate. Also to ask for a debate on firmer punishments for hate crimes.
attributes.additional_details: This is NOT about how people voted. It's about it being used as an excuse.

attributes.action: Ban tenant renewal fees
attributes.background: Why should we, the tenants, or even the landlords, have to pay out an extreme amount of money just for estate agents to print out the exact same paper as they did before, with just a couple of numbers changed? I SAY NO!
attributes.additional_details:
This world is hard enough you love in with all the prices on rent, bill, shopping etc, increasing all the time.
Estate agents make enough money from us.
It's extortionate for them to request more money for then to do absolutely nothing other than print out a bit of paper.
Anyone can do this.

That money being requested could go towards a lot of things you need.
DON'T let them keep doing this to you.
DON'T let them rip you off!!
Sign now, and let's fight back to take what is OURS!!

attributes.action: A Judicial Review on the exclusion of 16 to 18 year olds from the EU Referendum
attributes.background: The Scottish Referendum allowed 16 to 18 year olds to vote but the EU Referendum, which impacts the young disproportionately, did not. This decision was seemingly  based on cost considerations not on the legal precedence that has been set.

attributes.action: Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK
attributes.background:
Millions of EU citizens have been working in the UK for many years, many children were born in the UK from EU citizens, and as such, see Britain as their home as they grew up here and were taught the same values as all other British Children.
What conditions can you provide for them after Brexit?
attributes.additional_details:
Let EU immigrants know what the plans are regarding their future in the UK - immediately and without delay!

These families are all currently experiencing uncertainty and fear. Let them know what they can expect from the Government and don't keep them in the dark. They didn't have the right to vote in the Referendum, but they do have the right to know what will happen to their families, workplaces, mortgages, student loans and education, as well as safety and welfare.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to hold a second BREXIT referendum until 2036.
attributes.background: A referendum has already been held, and democracy is not about taking a second vote if you aren't happy with the first.
